result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig A. Brand was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Craig A. Brand is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Craig A. Brand was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Craig A. Brand was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Follow Prescription as directed.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with Kurt W, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Discharge - Regular
Assessment Report
of disposition of case; deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Celebre.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On ct 2 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; on ct 5 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions, concurrent to ct 2; credit for 147 days served if revoked; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $450 surcharge.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Celebre.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  On State's motion, cts 1, 3,4 & 6 are dismissed.  Deft pleads no contest to cts 2 & 5.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 2 & 5.  PSI ordered.  SEH 7/3/14 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Celebre.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Celebre states he needs more time to review all the evidence w/deft.  FPT continued to 5/15/14 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty D Celebre appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Celebre states he just received discovery, needs time to review it.  FPT continued to 4/30/14 at 9am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Celebre.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Celebre acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 3/21/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 4/8/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. David Celebre. Clerk LE.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 2-27-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
